conformance.naming

Class TestStorageServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • conformance.naming.TestStorageServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command, Storage
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CreationTest.CreationTestStorageServer, RegistrationTest.UnsuccessfulStorageServer

    class TestStorageServer
extends Object
implements Storage, Command
    Base class of storage servers used to test the naming server.

    Instances of this class and its subclasses are connected to the naming server under test. Methods of this class can be overridden to monitor the behavior of the naming server. The default implementations of the methods throw UnsupportedOperationException, indicating that a call to any of the methods in the client or command interfaces is not expected during a test.

    • Method Detail

      • startSkeletons

        protected void startSkeletons()
                       throws RMIException,
                              UnknownHostException
        Starts skeletons for the client and command interfaces.

        The naming server registration test has alternative implementations of the start method. Each such implementation calls this method to prevent repeated calls to start in the skeletons.

        Throws:
        RMIException - If either skeleton cannot be started.
        UnknownHostException - If a stub cannot be created from either of the skeletons.

      • start

        Storage start(Registration naming_server,
              Path[] offer_files,
              Path[] expect_files)
       throws RMIException,
              UnknownHostException,
              TestFailed
        Starts the test storage server.

        The storage server connects to the given naming server and attempts to register. It provides the naming server with the given list of files. If expect_files is not null, the storage server checks that the naming server then asks it to delete that set of files.

        Parameters:
        naming_server - The naming server with which the storage server is to register.
        offer_files - The list of files which is to be registered with the naming server.
        expect_files - An optional list of files which the storage server expects the naming server to ask it to delete. This parameter can be null if the storage server should not check which files the naming server replies with.
        Returns:
        The storage server client interface stub.
        Throws:
        RMIException - If the storage server skeletons cannot be started, or if the storage server is unable to register due to a network error.
        UnknownHostException - If one of the storage server stubs cannot be created.
        TestFailed - If expect_files is not null and the naming server does not reply with the correct set of duplicate files.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops the storage server.
